histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. This metric is logged by 2 different types of {DeviceMode}: "Clamshell" and "Tablet". This metric gets recorded for both the new quick settings view and the old unified system view, see "Ash.UnifiedSystemView.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen" which is the metric for the old view.

histogram.name: Ash.Rotation.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when rotating screen. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user rotates the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.DriveFileSuggestDataValidation.Status
histogram.summary: The outcome of drive file suggestion data validation. Recorded once per validation.

histogram.name: Ash.SearchModelUpdateTime.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the time interval between user-initiated search model updates after the user starts a search query. Used to record how quickly users update the search model in {TabletOrClamshell} after the first keystroke.

histogram.name: Ash.SearchResultUpdateAnimationShortened
histogram.summary: Records whether search result animation times were shorted for recent search result update animation preemptions. Recorded when productivity launcher search containers' results change while result containers are still animating.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.NumItemsEnabledUponSelection
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of menu items that are enabled in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.SelectedMenuItemIndex
histogram.summary: Tracks the index of the selected menu item in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NavigationButtonsInTabletMode.ReasonShown
histogram.summary: The reason shelf navigation buttons are shown in tablet mode. The buttons are shown when the device is in tablet mode only if certain accessibility settings are enabled. This histogram records which accessibility setting caused the buttons to be shown. Shown when navigation buttons visibility changes in tablet mode, and only if HideShelfControlsInTabletMode feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfItems
histogram.summary: The number of icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfPinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of pinned icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfUnpinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of unpinned icons in the shelf. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.CircledPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the screen area circled by the Assistant pen. Recorded when the "closed shape" gesture is recognized.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.DeprecateStylusFeaturesToastEvent
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user is shown the limitation toast notifying that the Assistant stylus features (i.e. what's on my screen) have been deprecated. Also considers whether or not the deprecation flag has been set. Recorded upon every stylus long press action.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of an Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the end of every gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between subsequent Assistant pen gestures within a session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of each gesture except for the first one in the session. The interval is computed excluding the gesture duration.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GesturesPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of Assistant pen gestures per session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GesturesPerSession.Recognized
histogram.summary: The number of recognized Assistant pen gestures per session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureType
histogram.summary: The type of the Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the end of each gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.HighlighterLength
histogram.summary: The length of a recognized "horizontal stroke" Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the and of the gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InAssistantMode
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in Palette Assistant mode. Recorded when the Assistant mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InLaserPointerMode
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend in Palette Laser pointer mode. Recorded when the Laser pointer mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InMagnifyMode
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend in Palette Magnify mode. Recorded when the Magnify mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.ModeCancellation
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a palette mode is explicitly cancelled or switched out of.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time that the palette option has been selected from the palette that has been opened manually (not via a stylus eject event).

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage.AutoOpened
histogram.summary: Recorded every time that the palette option has been selected from the palette that has been opened automatically (by a stylus eject event).

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage.Shortcut
histogram.summary: Recorded every time that the palette option has been selected by means other that the palette menu (e.g. stylus barrel button or a keyboard accelerator).

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.Action
histogram.summary: Track actions on the shutdown confirmation bubble, if it's opened, dismissed or which buttons are clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.ActionDuration.{BubbleAction}
histogram.summary: Track time delta between a bubble opened and an action taken on the shutdown confirmation bubble.

variant.name: Dismiss
variant.summary: User dismissed the shutdown confirmation buble

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.TimeToNextBoot.LoginShutdownToPowerUpDuration
histogram.summary: Emitted at device start-up if a shut-down was previously initiated from the shelf shutdown button. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf shutdown button was pressed and the device was powered up again soon after that.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between contiguous task switch user actions triggered by the Shelf buttons where the user activates a different user-predictable task. Task switches from other sources are ignored and do not affect this metric. In other words, if a user performs the following steps (1) launch task 'A' from the Shelf (2) Alt+Tab to task 'Z' (3) launch task 'B' from the Shelf, then this will result in a sample recorded for the time delta between launching tasks 'A' and 'B'.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenWindowMinimizedAndActivatedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time between a window being minimized by the shelf and subsequently activated. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf button pressed action causes a window to be minimized and the very next shelf button pressed action causes the same window to be activated.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.UkmLogger.HasNightLightSchedule
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user had set up a night light schedule at the time of night light event logging.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.UkmLogger.NumAvailableBluetoothDevices
histogram.summary: The number of Bluetooth devices available at the time of Bluetooth event logging.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentOverTime
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes), this is used instead of log in or shelf usage to track users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently and use a small number of browser instances or otherwise infrequently interact with the shelf launcher.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentUsage
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) when the shelf launcher is used to launch an app/window/etc, this is used instead of log in to give data on users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfIcon.AnimationSmoothness{ShelfIconAnimationType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the shelf icons. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Recorded when shelf icon animations are completed, including icon move, icon fade-in and icon fade-out. {ShelfIconAnimationType}

histogram.name: Ash.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow{Stage}
histogram.summary:
Tracks the percent of dropped frames in a 1 second sliding window.
PercentDroppedFrames is measured by tracking the number of frames which were not displayed on screen out of the total number of frames expected to be produced and displayed. In other words, the lower this number is, the smoother experience.
The metric is reported {Stage}.

variant.name: .DuringLogin
variant.summary: after cryptohome mount but before login animations finish

variant.name: .InSession2
variant.summary: after observing good ADF for 5 seconds

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.DeviceOrientation.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at entry to split view mode and each time the orientation or the device mode changes to report whether the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode and whether the orientation is landscape or portrait.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceUIMode
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.OrientationInSplitView
histogram.summary: Emitted when device orientation changes in split view, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.ResizeWindowCount.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of resizing window operations in split view mode session for both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.SwapWindowCount
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of swap window operations in split view mode session.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInMultiDisplaySplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in multi-display split view mode, meaning that split view is active on more than one display. The time is measured from when the number of displays in split view becomes more than one to when it drops back down to one.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInSplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in split view mode. The time is measured from the moment a window is snapped to one side of the screen to when split view mode is ended.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.{EngagementTime}.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode or the point of switching between clamshell mode and tablet mode in split view, to report the engagement time of general split view and multi-display split view in both clamshell mode and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.AnimationSmoothness.DividerAnimation
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animation when releasing the split view divider, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime.MaxLatency{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

histogram.name: Ash.StateKeysPresent
histogram.summary: The presense of state keys on first device policy fetch response. It is expected for state keys to be present. The histogram is logged only in case of successful device policy fetch response. Warning: This histogram was expired from 2022-07-03 to 2022-07-05; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.BounceIn
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounce in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely bounced in and shown the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.FadeIn
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely faded in and shown the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely hidden in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.{State}
histogram.summary: Logged when: Hidden: a TrayBackgroundView's preferred visibility is set to false. Shown: a TrayBackgroundView's preferred visibility is set to true. Pressed: Logged when a TrayBackgroundView is activated, either showing a bubble or handling a custom action.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayItemView.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the hide animation of tray item view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the tray item is completely hidden in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayItemView.Show
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the show animation of tray item view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the tray item is completely shown in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusAreaShowBubble.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while opening QuickSettings and Notification Center through Status Area button. Emitted when QuickSettings and Notification Center are opened and shown.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Tab.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation timestamp while dragging a tab in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Tab.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time while dragging a tab in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Window.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation timestamp while dragging maximized window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Window.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time while dragging maximized window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeHomeToOverviewGesture
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether a swipe from hotseat on home screen resulted in a transition to overview.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.PercentageOfWorkAreaHeightCoveredByMenu
histogram.summary: The height of the system menu divided by the height of the Ash desktop work area; a value over 100% indicates that a portion of the system menu is not visible to the user. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.Rows
histogram.summary: The number of user-visible rows in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a tab is dragged. In clamshell mode, each time a tab is dragged within a display, the time it takes to present the new frame on screen is recorded. In tablet mode (with webui tab strip enable), dragging between displays is precluded, thus each time a tab is dragged, the time it takes to present the new frame to screen is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum presentation time recorded during a tab dragging session in both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Enter
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when entering tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Exit
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between contiguous task switch user actions triggered by any of the other task switch actions that are tracked. (e.g., Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches, Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions, Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches, Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches, Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges, etc). Note the Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches and Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions histograms were deprecated and removed in 10/2016. Note that Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges was renamed from Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges on 04/2021.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.LidAngle
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. The computed angle between the lid and the keyboard panel. These values are imprecise and may be tens of degrees off from reality. Reported once per hour that the system is awake, and not reported if the system doesn't have two accelerometers.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActive
histogram.summary: The length of time that TouchView is active, for each activation.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActivePercentage
histogram.summary: The proportion of time spent in TouchView during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactive
histogram.summary: The length of time between TouchView activations.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is not active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.Button.Activated
histogram.summary: Recorded when any button in the old quick settings view is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.FeaturePod.{FeaturePodBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any FeaturePod in the old quick settings view. {FeaturePodBehavior} can be toggled to enable the feature, toggle to disable this feature, go to the feature's detailed page, or the feature pod is shown (visible).

variant.name: DiveIn
variant.summary: Go to the feature detailed page

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.Slider.{SliderBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any slider in the old quick settings view or in the slider bubble. {SliderBehavior} can be changing the value or toggling to enable the feature.

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen
histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the old system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. This metric is logged by 2 different types of {DeviceMode}: "Clamshell" and "Tablet". This metric gets recorded for both the new quick settings view and the old unified system view, see "Ash.QuickSettings.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen" which is the metric for the new quick settings view.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Jank
histogram.summary: Jank metrics of all animations applied during the unlock process. This represents how often the frame update rate changed during animation.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the unlock process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.TotalSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the entire profile data directory. Collected upon launching ash chrome.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.{ItemName}
histogram.summary: Records the size of each file/dir directly under user data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Collection
histogram.summary: The wallpaper collection of the selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtractionResult2
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate for wallpaper color extraction. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes for each extracted wallpaper prominent color.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.CustomLayout
histogram.summary: The custom wallpaper layout type. Recorded when the user sets a new custom wallpaper or changes the existing custom wallpaper's layout.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.ResponseTime.{Result}
histogram.summary: Records the response time for the {Result} request to the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted only on {Result} parsing of the API response at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result for the request to the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted for both failed and successful parsing of the API request at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.Result.Count
histogram.summary: Records the result count for the response of the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted only on successful parsing of the API response at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Source
histogram.summary: Records the section of the Wallpaper App from which a Google Photos wallpaper was selected. Emitted regardless of the selection's success.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image
histogram.summary: The selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Preview.Show
histogram.summary: Tracks the preview mode usage for wallpaper. Recorded each time the wallpaper image is previewed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Source2
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user attempts to set a wallpaper, either by the built-in Wallpaper App, or by a third party App. Note the wallpaper change triggered by Sync file system event doesn't count.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Type
histogram.summary:
The wallpaper type. Recorded at user login.
This metric expired in April 2022 and was revived in August 2022. Data between these times is incomplete.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of cross fade animation when setting window bounds. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when SetBoundsDirectCrossFade is called, such as when window is maximized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragMaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. Dragging the window back to the top of the screen will expand the window. This histogram is fired only if the window is initially maximized. If we drag a normal window to maximized state, the animation smoothness will be recorded in the regular cross fade histogram above. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothenss of the expand animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragUnmaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. This histogram is fired everytime we drag a maximized window to normal state. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothness of the shrink animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of hiding window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindowCommon is called, such as when window is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Minimize
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of minimizing window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindow_Minimize is called, such as when window is minimized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Snap
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of snapping window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when a window is snapped to the left or right in clamshell mode using the alt + [ or ] accelerator, but only if the size of the window's bounds change.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Unminimize
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of unminimizing window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateShowWindow_Minimize is called, such as when window is unminimized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.DragMaximized.NumberOfMisTriggers
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window state is being destroyed. Records number of mis-triggers of the drag to maximize behavior for a window during its lifetime.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.DragMaximized.Valid
histogram.summary: This boolean keeps tracking if a drag to maximize behavior is valid or not. Emits true if a window is dragged to maximized and stays maximized status over 5 seconds. If a window is dragged to maximized, but gets restored during 5 seconds, the drag to maximize behavior should be considered as invalid and a mis-trigger.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.Snap.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user snaps the window to record whether window snap is used while the display orientation is portrait or landscape mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.DesksSwitchDistance
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user ends window cycling via Alt-Tab, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and a new window was activated, to report the distance between the active desks before and after window cycling. A distance of 0 means no desks switch occurred.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.InitialMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user starts Alt-Tab, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the initial alt-tab mode, which signals user's saved and preferred mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.Items
histogram.summary: The number of windows in the Alt+Tab selector. Only recorded once when cycling starts, not every time when Tab is pressed without releasing Alt.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.ModeSwitchSource
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user switches the Alt-Tab mode, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report whether the user switches the mode via a click or keyboard.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SwitchMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user switches the Alt-Tab mode from a click or keyboard, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the alt-tab mode the user switches to.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between task switches triggered by the next window and previous window accelerator keys (ie Alt+Tab, Alt+Shift+Tab).

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.Container
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the window cycle view moves the next window into position when alt + tab is pressed. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.Show
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the window cycle view starts. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowDragFromShelfResult
histogram.summary: The final state after window drag gesture that started from the system shelf in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Success
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete. This does not include timeouts. Warning: this histogram was expired from M78 till M104.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Timeout
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete, for timeouts only. Warning: this histogram was expired from M78 till M104.

histogram.name: Ash.Wm.WindowSnapActionSource
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window is to be snapped. Records different ways for a user to snap a window.
